subject: Learning
title: Notification Overload
description: A micro-lesson that makes Notification Overload usable.

hook.text: The average smartphone user receives 80+ notifications daily. Most are glanced at, none ignored by the brain.

buildup.text: Each notification, even if dismissed, triggers a micro-interruption that pulls attention off task.

discovery.text: Studies show unread notifications reduce cognitive performance as much as actually checking them.

twist.text: Silencing your phone helpsâ€”but if you know notifications are piling up, your brain still monitors.

climax.text: The only effective fix is removing notifications entirely during focus periods, not just muting them.

punchline.text: You can't ignore what your brain won't stop tracking.

quiz.question: Why do unread notifications reduce cognitive performance?
options: The brain monitors accumulating notifications even when not checking
Notifications improve focus by keeping you alert
Only audible notifications cause any distraction
